docs.snippet: The Yankees came to terms with Brett Gardner and four others, but should the team sign Masahiro Tanaka, the Japanese pitching star, it could trigger the payroll luxury tax....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees came to terms with Brett Gardner and four others, but should the team sign Masahiro Tanaka, the Japanese pitching star, it could trigger the payroll luxury tax.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees settle all of their arbitration-eligible cases and sign five new players, inching closer to payroll threshold.

headline.main: Yankees Sign Five Players, Flirting With Payroll Threshold

docs.snippet: As Major League Baseball attempts to clean up the steroid scourge it helped create, it has been assaulting players’ rights. And Alex Rodriguez is right to push back....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Major League Baseball attempts to clean up the steroid scourge it helped create, it has been assaulting players’ rights. And Alex Rodriguez is right to push back.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports Of The Times column holds that Alex Rodriguez may be accomplishing a great deal of good by challenging his suspension from baseball; argues that MLB has increasingly impinged on players' rights as it seeks to clean up the steroids scourge it helped create, and asserts that Rodriguez is right to push back.

headline.main: Punishing Lords of Baseball Along With Their Fallen Idols
headline.print_headline: Punishing the Lords Along With Their Fallen Idols

docs.snippet: Michael R. Bloomberg’s dive back into the news side of Bloomberg L.P. has worried some that the division’s editorial independence could be called into question....
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg’s dive back into the news side of Bloomberg L.P. has worried some that the division’s editorial independence could be called into question.
docs.abstract: Michael R Bloomberg, two weeks removed from City Hall after three terms as mayor of New York City, takes more hands-on role at his company Bloomberg LP; his dive back into the organization's news side has not only caught employees by surprise, but it has also worried some that the division’s editorial independence could be called into question.

headline.main: After Leaving Office, Bloomberg Is More Hands-On at Old Company
